level-transcoder.description: Encode data with built-in or custom encodings. Used in [abstract-level].

level-test.description: Inject temporary and isolated [abstract-leveldown] stores ([leveldown], [level-js], [memdown] or custom) into your tests.
level-test.author: Dominic Tarr

level-compose.description: Compose a database factory from [abstract-leveldown] and [levelup] layers. TBD if still relevant after [abstract-level].

level-exists.description: Check if a datum exists without reading its value.

level-move.description: Move a value to another key.

level-create.description: Insert a key if and only if it doesn't already exist

level-create-batch.description: Insert a batch of keys if and only if none of the keys already exist

level-modify.description: Modify an existing key in [levelup]. Uses [level-lock]. See also [level-create] and [level-move].

batchlevel.description: Batch all operations made on a [levelup] instance. Compatible with [subleveldown].

ltest.description: Test function for [levelup] testing, based on [level-test].

level-probe.description: Get the first record in a range, using an iterator or stream. NB. Not compatible with latest [levelup].

autolevel.description: Automatically combine [levelup] with the right [abstract-leveldown] store for your configuration.

level-lazy-open.description: Lazily open a leveldown compatible backend.

changeset.description: Generate diff changesets for javascript objects, decomposing diffs into a series of puts and delete operations. The format is compatible with [levelup] batch operations. Useful to synchronize objects.

levelup-defaults.description: Change the defaults settings on a [levelup] instance by returning a new [levelup] instance that uses the same [abstract-leveldown] but different options.
